DataElement.preferredName: Death Date Subtract Diagnosis Date Duration Day Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from a person's date of death to the date of enrollment in a trial, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Death Date Subtract Diagnosis Date Day Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The cessation of life._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen._The act of removing a part from the whole._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._The period of time during which something continues.

The act of removing a part from the whole.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds.  This also refers to a specific day.:The period of time during which something continues.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.
